results.title: Neat on Paper
results.creator_credit: Sydney Filmmakers' Co-op Action Group, Mandy King, James Kesteven and Miriana Marusic
results.brief_description: The Sydney Filmmakers’ Co-operative was a major national agency for the distribution and exhibition of independently produced Australian film and video for over 20 years. This program examines the issues surrounding its closure in 1986.

results.title: Boys and Balls
results.creator_credit: Gil Scrine Films, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Thermal Falls, Anna Grieve and Sue Thomson
results.brief_description: It is in games many men discover their paradise. Robert Lynd. H.G. Nelson (Greig Pickhaver) and Rampaging Roy Slaven (John Doyle) host an amusing, often hilarious exploration of the fascination of men with balls; whether it is a cricket, football, tennis, basketball, soccer, bowls, table tennis, hockey or golf ball! Celebrities including Ted Whitten, Ron Barassi, Merv Hughes, Derek Kickett, Andrew Gaze, Lindsay Gaze, Francis Awaritife, Brad Mackay, Greg Champion and the average bloke and kid next door share favourite childhood memories of their sporting idols, humerous moments, coaching temperaments, the importance of rules and umpiring, and the incidence of sporting violence. Interviews, archival footage and famous quotes are intermixed in this perceptive program.

results.title: The Little ark
results.creator_credit: Cinema Center Films, Robert B Radnitz and James B. Clark
results.brief_description: Two children in Holland, Jan Brink and Adinda de la Maison are orphaned after they are separated from their parents when a flood washes away their town. They are picked up by an Urker sea captain, along with the pets they have salvaged from the flood; a cat, rabbit, rooster and a dog. The captain proves to be a captivating story teller with the ability to teach values such as love and respect through his stories. Starring Monica Achterberg, Genevieve Ambas, Philip Frame and Theodore Bikel as the captain. Filmed entirely in Holland and based on the novel by Jan De Hartog.

group_works.title: Aerobicide

results.title: Aerobicide
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audo
results.brief_description:
Set against a backdrop of a woman singing and the constant image of a woman’s legs in energetic cycling movements, a room full of men attempt to cultivate female
trends but are ultimately unsuccessful. The energy of the women in this short music clip, singing and exercising is a stark contrast to the inertia of the males around them.

results.title: Avengers: Endgame
results.creator_credit: Joe Howes, Joseph Richard Collins, Bailey Eller, Tommy Barry, Heather Armstrong, Louise Aubertin, Ben Cowell-Thomas, Charles Wood, Kristine Nadal, Joe Russo, Anthony Russo, Stephen McFeely, Myra N. Foy, Christopher Markus, Judianna Makovsky, Kevin Feige and Marvel Studios
results.brief_description: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War, the universe is in ruins due to the efforts of the Mad Titan, Thanos. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers must assemble once more in order to undo Thanos’ actions and restore order to the universe once and for all, no matter what consequences may be in store.

constellations_other.name: Easter Eggs on screen
constellations_other.description: People have been slipping secrets into films, games and television for as long as they have existed.

results.title: Discovering the Murray-Darling Basin
results.creator_credit: Kenyon Castle Productions, Murray-Darling Basin Commission (Australia) and Kenyon Castle
results.brief_description: Mike Hayes presents this video which shows the immense variety of Australia’s most important agricultural region, stretching from Queensland to South Australia. Not only is the area important agriculturally, but it is also an area of great beauty, rich in wildlife, history and folk lore. Produced for the Murray-Darling Basin Commission the program stresses that almost everybody in Australia is dependent in some way on this vast area and that therefore we should be working to prevent further degradation and repair some of the damage which has already been done.

results.title: Professional Development
results.creator_credit: Institute of Educational Administration and Ivan Gaal
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Case studies in effective schooling”.
Case studiesin effective schooling presents first hand accounts of how individual schools have gone about improving their effectiveness. “Professional development” is the second part in the series and records the manner in which Ivanhoe East Primary School supports its educational program with a coherent, planned program of professional development for its staff.

results.title: Shadow on the reef. Turning turtle.
results.creator_credit: Orana Films, National Geographic Society, ABC-TV (Australia) and Richard Dennison
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blue wilderness”.
“Shadow on the reef” looks at the incredible Whale Shark, the world’s largest shark. Valerie and Ron Taylor explore the wonders of the deep below the coral reef, emphasising the message that this fragile ecology is increasingly under threat.
“Turning Turtle” sees Ron and Valerie Taylor at odds with the Queensland Government over the fate of turtles on coral islands, with a focus on Raine Island. The Green Turtles are a rare and ancient species and the fight to save them pits the Taylors against bureaucracy and harsh physical conditions.
